lines.text: Miss Peters, as they say in horror movies, you will come to a bad end.
Why did you do it, my friend? You killed Ellen... and all of the others, too. You wanted everybody to think that it was me. Why, Herbert? Why did you want to destroy me? You love Dr. Death.
Now I must play the final scene, the death of Dr Death!
I don't make that cheap crap any more. I'm in television now.
Television? I thought that was a family medium.
Well, that's Hollywood for you, sweetheart. He's on the make. She's on the take.
Dr. Death, where are you? Let's smoke him out!
Everybody thinks I'm dead, including myself.
So you're the one who better watch it, mate.
Your drama school accent is slipping.
It's your favorite, Paul. Sour cream and red herrings.
Why not? After all, it IS my house. Paul, are you here? No, you're never here when I need you.

I used to laugh at the stories of women that got beat up for the hell of it. But the stories were true, Paul. Only this time, they got scared, they set the car on fire and rolled it down a hill. And when I came up, I wasn't pretty anymore.
